revision.comment: removed [[Category:Russian generals]]; added [[Category:Russian major generals]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox military person | name = Alexey Vasilievich Naumets | native_name = Алексей Васильевич Наумец | birth_date = 11 February 1968 | allegiance = [[Soviet Union]] (1986-1992)
[[Russia]] (1992-present) | branch = [[Soviet airborne]] (1986-1992)
[[Russian Airborne Troops]] (1992-present) | serviceyears = 1986-present | rank = [[Major general]] | commands = [[106th Guards Airborne Division]]
[[76th Guards Air Assault Division]] | battles = [[Second Chechen War]]
[[Russo-Georgian War]]
[[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation]] | awards = [[Order of Military Merit (Russia)|Order of Military Merit]] }} '''Alexey Vasilievich Naumets''' (Russian: Алексей Васильевич Наумец; born 11 February 1968) is a [[Russian Airborne Troops]] [[major general]]. He served with the airborne troops from 1986 and fought in the [[Second Chechen War]] and [[Russo-Georgian War]]. Naumets was severely injured in a car accident with Russian Airborne Troops commander [[Vladimir Shamanov]] in October 2010 while acting commander of the [[106th Guards Tula Airborne Division|106th Guards Airborne Division]]. In February 2013 he was appointed commander of the [[76th Guards Air Assault Division]] at [[Pskov]].{{Cite news|url=http://pln-pskov.ru/society/130597.html|title=Командиром 76-й десантно-штурмовой дивизии назначен полковник Алексей Наумец|date=1 March 2013|work=Pskov News Feed|language=Russian|trans-title=Colonel Alexey Naumets appointed commander of 76th Air Assault Division|access-date=28 May 2016|via=}} He was promoted to major general in June 2014.{{Cite web|url=http://informpskov.ru/news/146962.html|title=Командиру 76-й дивизии Алексею Наумцу присвоено звание генерал-майора|date=12 June 2014|website=Pskov Information Agency|language=Russian|trans-title=76th Division commander Alexey Naumets promoted to Major general|access-date=28 May 2016}} Naumets was placed on the [[European Union]] [[International sanctions during the Ukrainian crisis|sanctions]] list in September 2014 for his command of the 76th Guards Air Assault Division in Crimea.{{Cite news|url=http://www.consilium.europa.eu/uedocs/cms_data/docs/pressdata/EN/foraff/145571.pdf|title=List of persons and entities under EU restrictive measures over the territorial integrity of Ukraine|last=|first=|date=1 December 2014|work=|publisher=Council of the European Union|access-date=28 May 2016|via=}} == Military service == Naumets graduated from the Ryazan School of Communications in 1986 and was sent to the [[103rd Guards Airborne Division]] at [[Vitebsk]].{{Cite web|url=https://myslo.ru/news/arhiv/news-39139|title=У тульских десантников сменился комдив|date=28 July 2010|website=MySlo|language=ru-RU|trans-title=Tula Paratroopers Komdiv replaced|access-date=28 May 2016}} Naumets was involved in the suppression of the [[Fergana riots]] and the [[Osh riots (1990)|Osh riots]] in 1990. He served in the [[Second Chechen War]] with the [[247th Guards Air Assault Regiment|247th Air Assault Regiment]]. In 2005 he became chief of staff of the [[104th Guards Air Assault Regiment]] of the 76th Guards Airborne Division. On 2 June 2007 Naumets was appointed commander of the 247th Air Assault Regiment.{{Cite web|url=http://www.stapravda.ru/20070602/Novyj_kompolka_desantnikov_5491.html|title=Новый комполка десантников|website=www.stapravda.ru|language=Russian|trans-title=New regiment commander paratroopers|access-date=2016-05-28}} He led the regiment in the [[Russo-Georgian War]], where it fought in the [[Battle of Kodori Gorge]].{{Cite magazine|last=Metelev|first=Kirill|date=11 August 2015|title=Комдив Василич|trans-title=Komdiv Vasilich|url=http://konkretno.ru/veteran/blok4-veteran/80110-komdiv-vasilich.html|magazine=Командор|language=Russian|issue=1|access-date=28 May 2016}} On 24 August 2009 he became chief of staff of the [[106th Guards Airborne Division (Russia)|106th Guards Airborne Division]].{{Cite web|url=http://71ru.info/mag-arsenal/interview/1014-nastoyashhij-polkovnik.html|title=Настоящий полковник…|last=Kopytova|first=Yulia|date=6 May 2011|website=71ru.info|publisher=Magazine Tula Arsenal|language=Russian|trans-title=This colonel...|access-date=28 May 2016}} Naumets became acting commander of the division in July 2010. On 31 October he was seriously injured in a car accident along with Vladimir Shamanov.{{Cite web|url=http://ria.ru/incidents/20101031/291067564.html|title=Полковник Наумец, пострадавший в ДТП с Шамановым, пришел в сознание|date=31 October 2010|website=RIA Novosti|language=Russian|trans-title=Colonel Naumets injured in accident with Shamanov, regained consciousness|access-date=2016-05-28}} Division deputy commander [[Gennady Anashkin]] took command of the division. {{Ruheroes|iid=10935|name=Gennady Anashkin}} After recovering from his injuries Naumets resumed duty as division chief of staff.{{Cite web|url=http://www.tulapressa.ru/2012/03/naumec-ne-uchitsya-tolko-lenivyj/|title=Наумец: Не учится только ленивый|website=ИА «Тульская пресса»|language=Russian|trans-title=Naumets: Do not learn only lazy|access-date=2016-05-28}} On 27 February 2013 Naumets was appointed commander of the [[76th Guards Air Assault Division]] at [[Pskov]]. During the spring of 2014 the 76th Division participated in the annexation of Crimea. {{Cite web|url=http://pln-pskov.ru/society/169277.html|title=Псковские десантники, побывавшие в Крыму во время недавних событий, получили госнаграды и благодарности от президента|date=13 May 2014|website=pln-pskov.ru|language=Russian|trans-title=Pskov paratroopers in Crimea during recent events receive awards from President|access-date=2016-05-28}} On 12 June he was promoted to major general. For his leadership of the division in Crimea, Naumets was placed on the European Union sanctions list in September 2014. He was placed on the Canadian sanctions list in February 2015.{{Cite web|url=http://en.censor.net.ua/news/325132/canada_announced_further_sanctions_against_russian_and_ukrainian_individuals_and_entities|title=Canada announced further sanctions against Russian and Ukrainian individuals and entities|website=EN.Censor.net|language=en-EN|access-date=2016-05-28}} In late November 2015 Naumets was awarded the [[Order of Military Merit (Russia)|Order of Military Merit]] because the 76th Division was for three consecutive years considered the most efficient airborne detachment.{{Cite news|url=http://informpskov.ru/news/198941.html|title=Комдив 76-й дивизии ВДВ награждён орденом «За военные заслуги»|date=29 December 2015|work=Pskov Information Agency|language=Russian|trans-title=Komdiv 76th Division VDV awarded Order of Military Merit|access-date=28 May 2016}} == Personal life == Naumets is married to Nelly and has a son, Igor. == References == {{DEFAULTSORT:Naumets, Alexey}} [[Category:1968 births]] [[Category:Personnel of the Soviet Airborne Forces]] [[Category:Russian major generals]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Military Merit (Russia)]] [[Category:Living people]]
